sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you're in Japan, the <radical>fish</radical> in your <radical>village</radical> are <kanji>carp</kanji>. You may know them as <kanji>koi</kanji>, too.
meaningInfo: Picture your village in Japan. There's a big, still pond full of bright and beautiful giant carp. You hear the village kids giggle as they feed them and their big round mouths pop out of the water.
readingMnemonic: A <kanji>carp</kanji> is called a <reading>koi</reading> (<ja>こい</ja>) in Japanese. We've used that word before so I hope you know it by now. A koi is a koi, you know?
readingInfo: Carp are koi and koi are carp. Blub blub.
